changes.value: Restructure hero into a 2-column grid on desktop (60/40): left column = existing H1 + 3-bullet value summary (max 3 bullets, 1 line each), right column = static UI mock/preview panel; on mobile stack with preview below headline and keep total hero height under ~700px.
changes.rationale: Improves above-the-fold clarity and scannability for small business owners by presenting a quick summary plus a concrete visual anchor without adding new copy.
risks: Requires a credible preview asset; otherwise may look generic.

changes.value: In the hero, place 1 primary CTA + 1 secondary CTA side-by-side on desktop (min 44px height) and stacked on mobile; add a short inline micro-form option (email field) only on desktop, positioned directly under CTAs with a 12px gap.
changes.rationale: Creates a clearer conversion path above the fold while reducing friction for lead generation without pushing users to another page immediately.
risks: Inline form can reduce clicks but may lower completion if trust is weak.

changes.value: Enable a mobile sticky CTA bar after 40% scroll: primary CTA centered, secondary as a text link; keep bar height ~56px with safe-area padding and hide when the footer is in view.
changes.rationale: Maintains a persistent lead-gen path on mobile where users often scroll past CTAs, improving conversions without adding content.
risks: Can feel intrusive if it appears too early or overlaps UI.

changes.value: Reorder homepage sections to: Hero → Proof bar → Problem/Solution → How it works → Visibility/Auditability (observability) → Suite/Services overview → Pricing → FAQ → Footer; keep each section to 1 primary message + 3-5 bullets/cards max.
changes.rationale: Reduces cognitive load by moving credibility and process earlier, then reinforcing control/visibility before asking users to evaluate pricing.
risks: If current content relies on a narrative buildup, reordering may require minor trimming.

changes.value: Add a proof bar directly under the hero (desktop and mobile) with 3 compact items in a 3-column grid on desktop / horizontal scroll on mobile; include placeholders for logos, count metrics, or certifications with consistent 24px icon sizing.
changes.rationale: Improves trust quickly and supports lead intent without adding long testimonials or hype-heavy sections.
risks: Needs real proof artifacts; placeholders can undermine credibility.

changes.value: Introduce an 'auditability' pattern section using a split layout: left = 4-item checklist (events, owner approvals, changes, outcomes), right = an activity-feed mock with timestamps; keep feed to ~6 rows with 8px row gaps and a 'view details' affordance (non-copy).
changes.rationale: Strengthens the promise of visibility/control by showing concrete mechanisms (audit trail) rather than abstract claims, reducing perceived risk of handing work off.
risks: If the product doesn’t support these mechanics, it can create expectation mismatch.

changes.value: Add a persistent 'visibility panel' component used in 2 sections (How it works + Auditability): a compact card with 3 status indicators (On track / Needs input / Completed) and a weekly summary block; constrain width to ~360px and reuse styling for consistency.
changes.rationale: Reinforces observability as a repeated UI motif, making the system feel controllable and operational rather than consultative fluff.
risks: Overuse of UI motifs can feel repetitive if not varied per section.

changes.value: Convert pricing into 3 tier cards with one highlighted default tier; each card includes: price area, 5-bullet 'what you get' list, and a single CTA; add a 'compare features' accordion below that expands into a 2-column table on desktop and stacked rows on mobile (breakpoint 768px).
changes.rationale: Makes pricing easier to parse and reduces decision fatigue by emphasizing a default choice plus a clear comparison path for detail-oriented visitors.
risks: If tiers are not well-defined, highlighting one may feel arbitrary.

changes.value: Adopt a restrained, operational type scale with max line length: H1 48px/1.1 (mobile 32px), H2 32px/1.2 (mobile 24px), H3 20px/1.3, body 16px/1.6, small 14px/1.5; set default content max-width to 65ch (desktop) and 72ch hard cap for long-form sections; use font-weight 600 for headings and 400/450 for body to keep a calm, premium tone.
changes.rationale: A predictable scale + controlled measure increases readability and lowers cognitive load, signaling competence and safety without visual noise.
risks: If existing templates rely on wider text blocks, some layouts may need reflow to avoid awkward ragging.

changes.value: Standardize section spacing rhythm across home/services/about/contact: 96px vertical padding (desktop) / 56px (mobile) with an 8px base grid; enforce consistent intra-section spacing: 24px between heading and subcontent, 32px between content groups, and 48px before/after proof or pricing blocks; keep two-column sections at 12-col grid with 24px gutters (desktop) and single-column stack (mobile <768px).
changes.rationale: Consistent rhythm makes the experience feel operational and composed, reducing perceived risk and improving scanability for busy owners.
risks: Pages with very short content may feel sparse unless paired with tighter component density.

changes.value: Define a clear button hierarchy with safe-by-default states: Primary = solid fill, 44px min height (desktop) / 48px (mobile), 16px horizontal padding, 8px radius; Secondary = 1px outline; Tertiary = text button. Add states: hover (increase elevation by +1 shadow step), active (translateY 1px), focus-visible (2px ring with 2px offset), disabled (40% opacity + no shadow). Motion: 150ms ease-out for color/shadow only.
changes.rationale: A disciplined hierarchy and strong focus treatment communicates confidence and accessibility while keeping interactions calm and predictable.
risks: If brand colors are low-contrast, primary/secondary may require token adjustments to pass WCAG.

changes.value: Move to a premium, low-noise card spec: 12px radius, 1px border using neutral-200, background neutral-0, and a single subtle shadow (y=8 blur=24 at 10%); default padding 24px (desktop) / 16px (mobile). Provide two densities: 'standard' (24px padding, 16px gaps) and 'compact' (16px padding, 12px gaps) for service lists and FAQs; avoid heavy gradients and keep dividers at 1px.
changes.rationale: Border-led cards with restrained elevation feel safer and more enterprise/premium than heavy shadows, while density variants keep pages efficient.
risks: Overuse of cards can create a 'dashboard' feel; requires careful section spacing to avoid monotony.

changes.value: Introduce 'proof chips' as a compact trust pattern: 28–32px height, pill radius 999px, 12px horizontal padding, 1px border neutral-200, neutral background; optional leading icon at 16px. Use in rows of 3 on desktop and horizontal scroll on mobile with 12px gaps; include a 'verified' variant with subtle accent-tint background at 6–8% opacity (no more).
changes.rationale: Chips provide quick, low-commitment proof cues that feel controlled and non-salesy, supporting a safe-by-default impression.
risks: If too many chips are used, they can look like tag clutter; cap at 3–5 per section.

changes.value: Create an audit log preview component: a compact activity feed card with 6 visible rows, each row 40–44px height, 8px row gaps, left status dot (8px) + event title + timestamp aligned right; include a 1px divider between rows on dense mode and a top header with a 16px icon + label. Use monospace for IDs/timestamps at 12–13px, and color-code status dots with accessible contrast (success/warn/info) while keeping text neutral.
changes.rationale: A consistent, product-like log pattern signals operational rigor and accountability, reinforcing safety and control without adding copy.
risks: If the visual language implies real-time system behavior, it may set expectations that services must meet.

changes.value: Shift neutrals toward a calm, premium grayscale and enforce contrast: background neutral-0/#FFFFFF, surface neutral-50, border neutral-200, text neutral-900, secondary text neutral-700; ensure body text contrast ≥ 4.5:1 and UI text/icons ≥ 3:1. Reserve pure black for never; use neutral-950 sparingly for headings only.
changes.rationale: Neutral-led palettes feel safer and more professional, and explicit contrast targets reduce accessibility risk across pages and components.
risks: Existing brand palette may need slight adjustments to avoid clashes with new neutral surfaces.

changes.value: Add a consistent security/trust signal pattern near primary conversion areas (hero, contact form, pricing): a compact inline row using 16px icons + small text size (14px) inside a neutral-50 container with 12px padding and 8px radius; include optional 'last updated' timestamp styling and a discrete lock/shield icon style; keep spacing 12px between items and avoid banners taller than 56px on mobile.
changes.rationale: Subtle, consistent trust signals near high-intent actions improve perceived safety without feeling promotional or loud.
risks: If signals imply certifications or guarantees that aren’t true, it can create compliance and trust issues.

issues.description: Hero 2-col + UI mock may fail 8-sec test if it looks like SaaS, not consulting.
issues.rationale: Misclassification kills trust fast; visitors may bounce before seeing services fit or CTA.

issues.description: Hero inline email form adds friction without trust cues; may depress lead completion.
issues.rationale: Asking email pre-trust triggers hesitation; hurts primary goal (lead gen) at first touch.

issues.description: Sticky CTA at 40% scroll may appear before intent; can feel pushy on mobile.
issues.rationale: Premature interruption reduces perceived professionalism; can cause abandonment mid-scroll.

issues.description: Sticky bar height/safe-area may cover content or conflict with mobile browser UI.
issues.rationale: Obscured content blocks reading and taps; users miss key proof/pricing details.

issues.description: Section reorder adds many blocks; scannability may drop if each has bullets/cards.
issues.rationale: Too many micro-messages increases scroll fatigue; narrative clarity suffers before pricing.

issues.description: Pricing 3-tier highlight can feel arbitrary for services; may trigger skepticism.
issues.rationale: Services pricing needs rationale/fit; forced tiering creates doubt and stalls decision.

issues.description: Proof bar with placeholders/logos risks looking fake and undermining credibility.
issues.rationale: Low-quality proof near hero backfires; reduces trust right when asking for action.

issues.description: Audit log motif may overpromise operational tooling that consulting may not provide.
issues.rationale: Expectation mismatch creates distrust; prospects worry about bait-and-switch delivery.

issues.description: Repeated visibility panel in 2 sections may feel repetitive and “productized” vs bespoke.
issues.rationale: Repetition can read as template marketing; weakens premium consulting positioning.

issues.description: 65ch max width + new type scale may cause rag/awkward breaks in short sections.
issues.rationale: Poor rhythm hurts readability and perceived polish; users skim less and miss value.

suggestedFixes.fix: Make hero right panel a “deliverables preview” (timeline/checklist) not app UI; label it; keep 60/40 but add 16px eyebrow clarifier.
suggestedFixes.rationale: Reduces SaaS confusion and clarifies consulting outcome within 8 seconds.

suggestedFixes.fix: Gate inline email form behind secondary link (“Get a plan by email”); default hero to 1 primary CTA + 1 secondary; add 1-line privacy note.
suggestedFixes.rationale: Lowers early friction while keeping fast lead capture for high-intent visitors.

suggestedFixes.fix: Delay sticky CTA to 60% scroll or after Proof bar; add dismiss (X) and don’t reappear for 7 days via localStorage.
suggestedFixes.rationale: Preserves continuity without feeling aggressive; reduces repeat-visitor annoyance.

suggestedFixes.fix: Set sticky bar to 56px + safe-area inset; ensure it never overlaps inputs; hide on scroll-down, show on scroll-up; test iOS Safari.
suggestedFixes.rationale: Prevents content occlusion and improves thumb ergonomics on mobile.

suggestedFixes.fix: Trim to 6 core sections before pricing: Hero→Proof→Services overview→How it works→Objections/Risk reversal→Pricing; move auditability below pricing.
suggestedFixes.rationale: Reduces scroll fatigue and gets to decision content faster for busy owners.

suggestedFixes.fix: Enforce 1 headline + max 3 bullets per section; convert remaining details into accordions; add midpage CTA after “How it works”.
suggestedFixes.rationale: Improves skim path and adds a second conversion moment without extra length.

suggestedFixes.fix: Add “Who it’s for” line per tier + starting-at language; highlight tier only if backed by a “Most common” reason; avoid forced comparison on mobile.
suggestedFixes.rationale: Makes services tiers feel legitimate and reduces skepticism around highlighted plan.

suggestedFixes.fix: Do not ship placeholders; use 3 verifiable items (client types, years, projects) with footnote links; on mobile use snap scroll with 12px gaps.
suggestedFixes.rationale: Real proof increases trust; fake-looking proof destroys it.

suggestedFixes.fix: Rename to “Accountability log” and frame as process artifact; add disclaimer microcopy (“sample deliverable”); keep feed to 6 rows @ 44px.
suggestedFixes.rationale: Keeps observability benefit without implying a software product.

suggestedFixes.fix: Set section intros to 58–62ch and allow 72ch only for long-form; add responsive clamp() for H1 32–48px; test rag at 375px.
suggestedFixes.rationale: Maintains readability/polish across breakpoints and avoids awkward line breaks.
